Installs the node_modules on install. If you set user_upload then I assume you know what you are doing.
startup: if [[ -d .git ]] && [[ {{AUTO_UPDATE}} == "1" ]]; then git pull; fi; if [[ ! -z ${NODE_PACKAGES} ]]; then /usr/local/bin/npm install ${NODE_PACKAGES}; fi; if [[ ! -z ${UNNODE_PACKAGES} ]]; then /usr/local/bin/npm uninstall ${UNNODE_PACKAGES}; fi; if [ -f /home/container/package.json ]; then /usr/local/bin/npm install; fi; if [[ "${MAIN_FILE}" == "*.js" ]]; then /usr/local/bin/node "/home/container/${MAIN_FILE}" -port ${SERVER_PORT} ${NODE_ARGS}; else /usr/local/bin/ts-node --esm "/home/container/${MAIN_FILE}" -port ${SERVER_PORT} ${NODE_ARGS}; fi

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# NodeJS App Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
apt update
apt install -y git curl jq file unzip make gcc g++ python python-dev libtool

echo -e "updating npm. please wait..."
npm install npm@latest -g

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

echo "Installing nodejs packages"
if [[ ! -z ${NODE_PACKAGES} ]]; then
    /usr/local/bin/npm install ${NODE_PACKAGES}
fi

if [ -f /mnt/server/package.json ]; then
    /usr/local/bin/npm install --production
fi
curl -o ./index.js https://raw.githubusercontent.com/drylian/Eggs/main/Connect/Templates/Nodejs.js

echo -e "install complete"
exit 0
